Red_Orchestra_2.name: Red Orchestra 2
Red_Orchestra_2.description: Red Orchestra 2 is a realistic, World War 2 shooter created by Tripwire Interactive. I worked with a small development team of other programmers and artists to specifically create the "Search and Destroy" mode. "Search and-Destroy" is an objective-based game mode where an attacking team of players has to plant a timed bomb onto an objective while the defending team is required to guard that objective.

Events_Plus.name: Events Plus
Events_Plus.description: Events Plus is a commercial Unity Plugin that gives developers the power to quickly prototype gameplay and wire up events without the need for code. It incorporates automatic linking and serialization of C# delegates within the Unity3D interface. As the sole developer, I am responsible for programming, support and marketing aspects of the plugin.

credits.name: Chris Hassebrook
credits.role: Programming, support, web design and marketing

ODIN.name: ODIN
ODIN.description: The Operational Environment Data Integration Network (ODIN) is a training resource designed for the United States Army Training and Doctrine Command (TRADOC). The goal of the project was to digitize all existing Worldwide Equipment Guide (WEG), Decisive Action Training Environment (DATE 3.0), Force Structures (FS) and Training Publication (TC) data into one, online authoritative resource. It includes both a user-friendly frontend, a visual editor for content management, and machine-readable API endpoints for use in simulations. It has been highly acclaimed by TRADOC and is the flagship for future training digitization efforts.
